activity.description: Two players compete to see who can press their button the most times in a short period of time. Push your color to the other player to win. Red vs Blue.
activity.name: Rapid Versus

activity.description: The light goes around in a circle. Press a button when its lit up and you move on to the next level. Press a button when its off and it is game over. No rush since there is no time limit to push a button.
activity.name: Catch the Circle Runner

activity.description: Create colors by mixing red, green, and blue. What colors can you make?
activity.name: Color Mixer

activity.description: See ten colors, pick one to see it and hear its name.
activity.name: Pick A Color (English)

activity.description: See ten colors, pick one to see it and hear its name.
activity.name: Pick A Color (Spanish)

activity.description: See ten colors, pick one to see it and hear its name.
activity.name: Pick A Color (Chinese)

activity.description: Find the matching pairs of colors. Press each button to find out what color it is. Also called Concentration. Play by yourself or take turns with others.
activity.name: Memory

activity.description: Play the drums.
activity.name: Drum Kit

activity.description: See who has the fastest reflexes. Everyone pick a button. When the lights turn green, the first person to press their button is the winner. Don't press your button too early or you lose.
activity.name: Fastest Press

activity.description: Repeat back the pattern Simon gives you. Each time you repeat the pattern back correctly, the pattern gets one button longer. How long can you go?
activity.name: Simon Says

activity.description:
Press each button as soon as it lights up. The faster you press the buttons the higher your score.

Compare to Whac-A-Mole®
activity.name: Press a Mole

activity.description: Guess the number I am thinking of between one and ten. See how many guesses it takes to get the right answer.
activity.name: Guess The Number

activity.description: Press a button and hear the count of how many buttons you have pressed. How high can you go?
activity.name: Button Press Counter

activity.description: Press a button and hear the count of how many buttons you have pressed. How high can you go? The lights show your number in binary.
activity.name: Button Press Counter - Binary

activity.description: Press a button to turn it off and on. Hear the count of on buttons.
activity.name: Count On

activity.description: See how AND, OR, NOT, XOR logic gates work by turning inputs on and off on the bottom row and seeing the output on the top row.
activity.name: Logic Gates

activity.description:
A noise machine that can provide relaxing sounds. Choose from the following sounds: 

Fireplace
Machine Hum
Waves
Crickets
Rain
Birds
Crowd of People
Brook
Train
Washing Machine
activity.name: Sound Machine

activity.description: Turn all the buttons green by clicking buttons to change their color. Pay attention as buttons may change their neighbors colors too.
activity.name: The All Green Puzzle

activity.description: Make simple designs by changing the button colors. Click a button to change its color.
activity.name: Pixel Art

activity.description: Play 10 different nursery rhymes with animated lights.
activity.name: Nursery Rhymes

activity.description: Play funny sounds. Each button is a different sound.
activity.name: Funny Sounds

activity.description: Press the button(s) that are lit up to hear a fun sound.
activity.name: Find Button

activity.description: Hear the names of the planets in our solar system and also the Sun and Pluto.
activity.name: Solar System Names

activity.description: Hear the names of the planets in our solar system and also the Sun and Pluto.
activity.name: Solar System Names Quiz

activity.description: Hear the names and facts of the planets in our solar system and also the Sun and Pluto.
activity.name: Solar System Facts

activity.description: Test your knowledge about the planets in our solar system as well as the sun and pluto.
activity.name: Solar System Facts Quiz

activity.description: Fun song about the planets of the solar system
activity.name: We are the Planets of the Solar System

activity.description: How much do you weigh on each planet?
activity.name: Solar System Weights

activity.description: Restart the device
activity.name: Restart

activity.description:
The award-winning Story Pirates Podcast takes stories written by kids and turns them into sketch comedy and songs. Made up of talented comedians, songwriters, and frequent celebrity guests, the Story Pirates inspire kids to create, bringing laughter to kids and grownups of all ages with hilarious sketches, catchy original songs from all genres, and interviews with the creative geniuses behind the stories… kids!

This podcast is independently produced and the content is not controlled by 10 Buttons. It may contain ads. Please verify the content is appropriate for you and your listeners.
activity.name: Story Pirates

activity.description:
But Why is a show led by kids. They ask the questions and we find the answers. It’s a big interesting world out there. On But Why, we tackle topics large and small, about nature, words, even the end of the world. Know a kid with a question? Record it with a smartphone. Be sure to include your kid's first name, age, and town and send the recording to questions@butwhykids.org!

This podcast is independently produced and the content is not controlled by 10 Buttons. It may contain ads. Please verify the content is appropriate for you and your listeners.
activity.name: But Why: A Podcast for Curious Kids

activity.description:
Created and produced by parents of young children, WBUR's Circle Round adapts carefully-selected folktales from around the world into sound- and music-rich radio plays for kids ages 3-103. Each 10- to 20-minute episode explores important issues like kindness, persistence and generosity. And each episode ends with an activity that inspires a deeper conversation between children and grown-ups.

This podcast is independently produced and the content is not controlled by 10 Buttons. It may contain ads. Please verify the content is appropriate for you and your listeners.
activity.name: Circle Round

activity.description:
A History Podcast for Kids! Parents love us, Teachers love us, and most importantly, kids do too!
History can be amazing, inspiring and relevant to anyone.  We love to share the stories of Spies, funny foods, George Washington's foibles, early advancements in cartooning and ballooning and much more! A professional music score and important songs accompany nearly every themed episode.  Proud Kids Listen Member @pastandcurious

This podcast is independently produced and the content is not controlled by 10 Buttons. It may contain ads. Please verify the content is appropriate for you and your listeners.
activity.name: The Past and The Curious: A History Podcast for Kids and Families

activity.description:
Unspookable is a family friendly look at the histories and mysteries behind your favorite scary stories, myths and urban legends. Each week host Elise Parisian digs into the history, brain science, and power dynamics behind such topics as Bloody Mary, Charlie Charlie, and Ouija Boards to find the stories behind the scares. (Recommended for ages 8+)
Unspookable has been called one of the "Best podcasts for kids of all ages" by Time Out New York, one of the “7 Podcasts Big Kids Will Love” by The New York Times, one of the "5 Spooky Podcasts to Check Out Right Now" by Vulture, one of the "10 Best Podcasts for Children" by the Irish Examiner, and is an official Common Sense Media Selection. The show has appeared multiple times across Canada on CBC Radio's Podcast Playlist, on NPR station WHYY's Kid's Listening Hour, has been featured by Apple Podcasts, Romper, The AV Club, Fast Company, The Week Jr, Podcast Magazine, and more.

This podcast is independently produced and the content is not controlled by 10 Buttons. It may contain ads. Please verify the content is appropriate for you and your listeners.
activity.name: Unspookable
